item.title: Hahn Decomposition Theorem
item.description:
Theorem1 (a) Let $
u$ be a signed measure defined on a measurable space $(X, \mathcal{E})$. Then there exist a positive set $P$ and a negative set $N$ for $
u$, satisfying the following: $$ P \cup N=X \quad 	ext{and} \quad P \cap N =\varnothing $$ Such a $X=P \cup N$ is called a Hahn decomposition for $
